channel.title: Fallout 3?
channel.description: I just started playing Fallout 3 last friday, it kinda sucked me in. Came nowhere as close as the Half-life Universe, but still it's a pretty formidable game. What do you people that have played it think? Any opinions, memories, good mods? Just wondering what other people think about it.

item.title: Fallout 3?
item.dc:creator: liam72
item.description:
I never (well…) got any problem about multiposting before. I would edit my post now, but there is no “delete” option.

About console vs PC versions. Well yeah, consoles have dlc, but you have to pay for it (which is stupid, but standard marketing). With PC you have many free mods.

Read full topic

item.title: Fallout 3?
item.dc:creator: AI13
item.description:
I got Fallout 3 exactly 7 days ago, and have already beaten it 3 times, I bought the GOTY edition over Steam to replace the torrented version I had and have had a very enjoyable time playing it. You did ask about mods and thus I have to warn you, be careful if you use a custom race. If you do, and apply the race before you begin Broken Steel you will run into a glitch that prevents Broken Steel from loading. There is another problem that you might run into involving Scribe Rothchild and his bloody map, but I have yet to discover if that is caused by mods, or the game itself, (I have also yet to discover a fix for it). It is an amazing game, with quite a few good mods out there. My personal favorite is this one> https://www.fallout3nexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=5666. Excellent retexture of the Chinese Stealth Armor.
Other then those two glitches, it has been an amazing game for me. Have fun.

Edit: I did not see you post information about what distribution method you purchased the game over, as such, if you purchased a physical copy, you should get the FOSE, or Fallout Script Extender. It opens up a plethora of fun mods for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Fallout 3?
item.dc:creator: Guzzi
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

Yeah, “Operation: Anchorage” sucks.

It was the least fun out of all the DLC but you also get the best armor in the game after you finish it. (Winterized TB-51 and the Chinese Stealth armor)  As well as the Gauss rifle (Which is alright, I just like how it knocks the toughest enemies on their ass really. The Victory Rifle does too though I suppose.)
DansonDelta40:

A bunch of guys from the original Fallout Team are with Obsidian Entertainment, working on Fallout: New Vegas. That’s probably why you seemed to think it was the original developers doing it. Some of the most important and influencial designers of Fallout 1 and 2 are with them, so we can expect something that tries to stay true to the original.

Fallout: New Vegas is an upcoming game announced by Bethesda Softworks on April 20, 2009 at its London showcase. While New Vegas is not a direct sequel, it will be in the same style as Fallout 3 and will be developed by Obsidian Entertainment, a company founded by some of the developers of Fallout and Fallout 2. Based on the title, it will be set in Las Vegas. It has a projected release date of 2010 and will be available on the PC, Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. “Fallout Wiki” https://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Portal:Fallout:_New_Vegas

New Vegas will still use the fallout 3 engine GECK.

https://fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Fallout:_New_Vegas_FAQ

Read full topic

item.title: Fallout 3?
item.dc:creator: liam72
item.description:
Someonerandm:

I feel like the only person in the world who really didn’t like Fallout 3. As in, not even just average like Halo, but below average. Maybe I just played it right after I had gotten completely bored of Oblivion (After about 150 hours), and it just was too samey. Oh well. Gun play still sucks.

I got through Oblivion vanilla, then again with all the mods I could fit in my computer and I (obviously) loved Oblivion. Then right after that I downloaded Fallout 3 and went through it with a constant sense of deception. I was … angry… at Bethesda, and pissed of everybody praising its “greatness”. It only seemed like a cheap guns version of Oblivion to me. (I also tried Morrowind, but being young and superficial, I couldn’t go over the fact that its graphics are old and the gameplay is plain bad)

Then about a month ago I bought it for PS3. I’m not saying it’s better on PS3, but this time I really got into it. I think that I was just too obsessed with oblivion to appreciate Fallout 3 …

Read full topic

Bethesda said that New Vegas will be a similar experience to Fallout 3. But hopefully New Vegas will have the same “feel” as the old Fallouts just to shut up the haters.

No way its going to make its release date of June. A game as popular as Fallout would almost certainly get its pseudo-sequel overhyped long before its release.

That’s what delays are for. And I for one really don’t care if they hype it up. All I care is for a good game in the end.

Holy crap that’s awesome. Just to be sure January 27th right?

Yep

HeadCrabZombie:

Also don’t count on any more DLC. “Mothership Zeta” was their last planned DLC project. They could always come back and do something like that but don’t hold your breath.

Oh well, Fallout: New Vegas is coming out next year and it’s going to own!
